title: Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Gerald Dorgan, 75, died after being critically injured in a shooting at a Pawtucket ice rink on February 16.
The shooting at Dennis M. Lynch Arena was a targeted family dispute, resulting in three family members' deaths.
The shooter, Robert Dorgan, was disarmed by citizens and later died by self-inflicted gunshot wound.

title: Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matt Lyons rescued Pixie, a cat stuck 50 feet up a tree during Rhode Island's blizzard, using his climbing skills.
Heather MacKinnon noticed Pixie was trapped for nearly two days while authorities advised contacting tree services for help.
Neighbours used social media to seek help, leading Lyons to successfully climb and rescue Pixie amid deep snow.

title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins will play 25 regular-season games in 8 weeks, starting with the Columbus Blue Jackets at TD Garden.
Boston's penalty kill ranks 28th in the NHL while leading in penalty minutes, a concern for Coach Marco Sturm.
The Bruins may consider trades before the March 6 deadline, focusing on long-term assets like Robert Thomas or Elias Pettersson.

title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A fire erupted at MCI-Norfolk prison on Wednesday afternoon, affecting one of its housing units.
Three incarcerated individuals were treated for smoke inhalation; one staff member sought hospital evaluation as a precaution.
The cause of the fire is unknown, and officials are assessing damage and potential housing impacts.

title: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an NBA MVP candidate amid a standout season for the Boston Celtics.
Boston Celtics, despite significant roster changes and Jayson Tatum's injury, sit second in the Eastern Conference at 38-19.
Jaylen Brown averages 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists, leading the Celtics as a scoring threat in Tatum's absence.

title: Harvard professor on leave as college investigates ties to Jeffrey Epstein
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Harvard professor Martin Nowak is on leave amid an investigation into his ties with Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein donated $6.5 million to Harvard's Program for Evolutionary Dynamics, which Nowak directed.
DOJ documents show Nowak visited Epstein's island in 2013 and facilitated Epstein's visits to Harvard.

title: Malden educator, basketball coach charged with rape in incident involving high school student, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Scott Marino, Malden educator and basketball coach, arrested on charges including rape and indecent assault.
Charges relate to alleged incident involving Malden High School student, said to occur outside working hours.
Marino placed on leave; Middlesex District Attorney's Office handling case; further inquiries directed to prosecutors.

title: Red Sox’ Wilyer Abreu explains viral broken-bat check swing
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox outfielder Wilyer Abreu's bat broke during a check swing in a game against the Pirates.
Abreu speculated the bat was compromised from a prior at-bat despite not feeling immediate defects.
Abreu hit 22 home runs, drove in 69 runs, and won a Golden Glove despite injuries last season.

title: All Mass. customers should have power fully restored by end of Friday night, Eversource says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Eversource aims to restore power to 160,000 customers in Eastern Massachusetts by midnight Friday after Monday's blizzard.
Cape Cod, Martha's Vineyard, and areas like Plymouth have major outages, with some towns waiting until Friday for restoration.
Eversource and National Grid brought in extra crews; some linemen are working 18-hour shifts to expedite power restoration.

title: Team USA captain Hilary Knight reacts to Trump’s ‘distasteful’ joke about U.S. women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hilary Knight criticized Trump's joke about the US women's hockey team as distasteful after winning Olympic gold.
The US women's team declined Trump's State of the Union invitation due to prior commitments, despite appreciating the recognition.
Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman expressed regret over the men's team reaction to Trump's joke, emphasizing respect for the women’s team.
